feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued August 20 at 5:21AM AKDT until August 20 at 6:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...South winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * WHERE...Near Donnelly Dome. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 4:39AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PERIODS OF RAINFALL WILL CONTINUE ACROSS ANCHORAGE THROUGH TONIGHT... An additional 0.20" to "0.30" is expected for the Anchorage Bowl Saturday morning through Saturday night. This is due to the persistent moist, southwest flow aloft around an upper level low. Rainfall should taper off by Sunday morning with just a few

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 19 at 9:33PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory is in effect... * WHAT...Surf of 14 to 17 feet. * WHERE...Southern facing shores of all islands. * WHEN...through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect ocean water occasionally sweeping across beaches, very strong breaking waves, and strong longshore

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 1:02PM MST until August 20 at 3:30PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR PINAL COUNTY... At 102 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:41AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY FOR WESTERN MASSACHUSETTS AND NORTHWESTERN CONNECTICUT... Moderate to severe drought conditions across the Berkshires and northwestern Connecticut will result in elevated fire weather concerns today. Relative humidity values will drop to 35 to 40 percent this afternoon with southerly winds of 5 to 10 mph and

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:12AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED FIRE WEATHER CONCERNS TODAY FOR CONNECTICUT... The potential for fire spread is enhanced. The prolonged absence of wetting rains, along with moderate to severe drought conditions, have led to very dry soil moistures and ground fuels. Any fire that ignites will easily and rapidly spread in these conditions.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 12:20PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...CONDITIONS REMAIN FAVORABLE FOR FUNNEL CLOUDS THIS AFTERNOON... Current atmospheric conditions support the development of funnel clouds. The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. A few spots may briefly reach 110 this afternoon. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued August 20 at 3:44AM CDT until August 21 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Aransas Islands, Kleberg Islands, Nueces Islands and Calhoun Islands Counties. * WHEN...From this evening through Sunday evening.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Aransas Islands; Calhoun Islands; Kleberg Islands; Nueces Islands

entry.title: Rip Current Statement issued August 20 at 3:42AM CDT until August 21 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM CDT THIS MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...Kenedy Island, Willacy Island and Cameron Island Counties. * WHEN...From 7 AM CDT this morning through Sunday evening.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cameron Island; Kenedy Island; Willacy Island

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 20 at 1:53PM MDT until August 20 at 2:30PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Beaver County in southern Utah... North central Iron County in southern Utah... * Until 230 PM MDT * At 153 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 32 miles southwest

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 1:49PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Beaver and north central Iron Counties through 215 PM MDT... At 149 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 32 miles east of Ranch Campground, or 35 miles northeast of Ursine, moving east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 1:38PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Garfield County through 215 PM MDT... At 138 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles west of Escalante. This storm is moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 12:52PM MDT until August 20 at 2:30PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central Colorado and east central Utah, including the following counties, in west central Colorado, Mesa. In east central Utah, Grand.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 2:19PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Wisconsin, including the following counties, Dane, Green, Iowa and Lafayette. * WHEN...Until 530 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 2:03PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Wisconsin, including the following county, Milwaukee. * WHEN...Until 515 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 20 at 9:05AM CDT until August 20 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous swimming conditions are expected along the Lake Superior shoreline due to high wave action and strong rip currents. * WHERE...Minnesota Park Point and Wisconsin Point Beaches.
